intro: Helicteres trapezifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leafed false mallow, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant features palmately lobed leaves and produces showy, yellow flowers with a distinctive reddish calyx. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in woodland areas. Its botanical characteristics make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
